metadata.title: CVE-2016-1567 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
chrony before 1.31.2 and 2.x before 2.2.1 do not verify peer associationsof symmetric keys when authenticating packets, which might allow remoteattackers to conduct impersonation attacks via an arbitrary trusted key,aka a "skeleton key."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1567` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chrony - 3.2-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chrony package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2-4ubuntu1').
